overview:
Derick Jacob Goff (born January 31st, 1995) is the President, Founder, and current C.E.O of Bazaar Media Group; a British-American entertainment group catered exclusively to teenagers.

Bazaar Media [and its Daily News site] has consistently received positive Alexa.com reviews, and is seen by more than 45% of the global internet population.

Daily News, the co’s first entity was launched in August 2009 following the death of its then 18-year-old co-founder Taylor Wallis.

To date,Daily News has remained clear of salacious scandals that could harm their trusted reputation.

As of Sept. 2012, the co itself has more than 7 different entities to its name, including but not limited to, a private holdings listing, 6 additional news websites, and rights to distribute both books and musical CD’s.

The company’s most recent acquisition was that of Pop Teen, soon followed by an impending purchase of Gladeon Entertainment; a music distribution co.

Bazaar Media is currently privately held under Bazaar Holdings LLC in the United Kingdom.

milestones.description: Original co-founder of Bazaar Daily News (Taylor Mackowiak-Wallis)  is deceased.
